meanings.definition: To renounce or repudiate under oath
meanings.sent1: She was forswearing any involvement in the crime during the court hearing.
meanings.sent2: He forswore his allegiance to the king in front of the entire court.
meanings.sent3: The magician forswearing his magic tricks left the audience in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: By forswearing his past mistakes, he embraced a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The act of forswearing in court carries serious consequences.

meanings.definition: To swear falsely or commit perjury
meanings.sent1: The witness was forswearing when he claimed he didn't see anything.
meanings.sent2: She forswore her promise to keep the secret and revealed it to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The student forswearing his innocence about the missing homework made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: By forswearing the truth, he dug himself deeper into trouble.
meanings.sent5: The act of forswearing in court undermines the justice system.

meanings.definition: To reject or deny something vehemently
meanings.sent1: He was forswearing any involvement in the scandal to protect his reputation.
meanings.sent2: She forswore the accusations of cheating with a firm denial.
meanings.sent3: The cat forswearing the new food by refusing to eat it was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: By forswearing the offer, he missed out on a great opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The politician's forswearing of the allegations only fueled more speculation.
